par.text: Potassium is found in nature only in the combined state. Potassium chloride - KCl - is the most common potassium compound, occurring as the mineral sylvite. Potassium ranks 8th in abundance amongst elements in the Earth's crust. It constitutes 2.1% of the Earth's crust by weight. Compounds of potassium are often associated with rock salt deposits, and are also present in seawater.
